results.title: Almos' a man
results.creator_credit: Stan Lathan, Dan McCann and Perspective Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The American Short Story”.
Dave - a black, teenage worker - buys a used hand gun and accidentally kills a mule. Consequently, his father demeans him in front of the landowner, who demands that he work 25 months to pay for the animal. At nightfall, aimed with vague notions of manhood and independence, Dave retrieves his gun and hops aboard a passing train.

results.title: Wooden chains
results.creator_credit: Jim Willox, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: He would whittle away at scraps of wood for hours, lost in the quiet moments of himself, perhaps trying to make sense of the war, we’ll never know. A son’s reflection on the life of his father, a veteran from World War I, who returned both psychologically and physically scarred but would never share these scars with the rest of his family, choosing to spend his later years in quiet and solitary contemplation. Jim Willox and his family can only guess at the trauma that bellies the whittling his dad so regularly engaged in. A tribute to a war veteran by his son, who will never fully comprehend all he went through.

results.title: The Music school
results.creator_credit: John Korty, Dan McCann and Learning in Focus
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The American Short Story”.
An adaptation of John Updike’s short story written in 1964 in which a middle aged writer attempts to find some meaning for his life. Narrated by Colleen Dewhurst.

results.title: Bernice bobs her hair
results.creator_credit: Joan Micklin Silver, Paul R. Gurian and Perspective Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The American Short Story”.
A young flapper bobs her hair to gain peer approval but she learns a lesson in values. An adaptation of the short story of the same title by F. Scott Fitzgerald.

results.title: Wings
results.creator_credit: Jack McMahon, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Jack McMahon wanted to be a pilot for as long as he can remember. When war was declared, he signed up as soon as he could and, unsurprisingly, joined the Air Force. He warmly talks about his time during World War II, the friendships and bonds created and the crucial moments during the war where he needed to step up and take a chance. Despite being told by his instructor that he was going to kill himself, Jack McMahon returned to Australia and was honoured for his services during the Anzac Day football match in 2008.

results.title: Mark Twain's 'The man that corrupted Hadleyburg'
results.creator_credit: Ralph Rosenblum, Christopher Lucas and Perspective Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The American Short Story”.
Based on the story of the same title by Mark Twain, about a small town visited by a stranger who concocts a scheme to test the honesty of the town’s leading citizens. Stars Robert Preston, hosted by Henry Fonda.

results.title: Ambrose Bierce's 'Parker Adderson: Philosopher'
results.creator_credit: Arthur Barron, Ozzie Brown and Perspective Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The American Short Story”.
Parker Adderson is a captured Yankee spy whose facile philosophy and flippant concern for life arouse a Confederate general’s instinct for sham. The harsh reality of his impending execution brings abrupt character changes in Adderson, and a vicious battle in the general’s tent ensues.

results.title: V160777 (Chocos)
results.creator_credit: Bill Goodes, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When he signed up as a conscript, Bill Goodes was given the number V160777 and the label Choco. He knew it was given to the conscripts that, like him, fought in New Guinea, but he had no idea what it meant, though he did sense the connotation was negative. He reflects on how he fought like any other soldier, for three years without a break. In New Guinea, he was just like everyone else. But when he returned to Australia to take up life as a dairy farmer, he soon realised that some people just saw him as a Choco. For Bill, none of this has detracted from his contribution to the war effort.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill Goodes, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Gay Divorcee cinema slide
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures and Mark Sandrich
results.credit_line: ACMI has endeavoured to contact the owners of these objects since their deposit in 2015. Unfortunately this has been unsuccessful. We would welcome any information to identify the owners.
results.brief_description: Two glass sheets: one glass only and the other with slide imagery which has a monochromatic emulsion that has then been hand painted with coloured pigments or dye. TEXT on the slide reads: The original would have read in it’s entirety: You are now listening to the Theme Songs of The Gay Divorcee Starring: Fred Astaire Ginger Rogers an R.K.O Radio Picture
results.description: Two glass sheets: one glass only and the other with slide imagery which has a monochromatic emulsion that has then been hand painted with coloured pigments or dye. results.title: I'm a fool
results.creator_credit: Noel Black, Dan McCann and Perspective Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The American Short Story”.
This adaptation of Sherwood Anderson’s short story tells of a few milestones in the life of an adolescent boy who, at the turn of the century, left home and attempted to make a life of his own. Stars Ron Howard.
